intro: Pollia japonica var. miranda, commonly known as the Japanese spiderwort, is a species of flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
